criterion: Provides an overly concise summary that fails to convey important information
Correctly identifies bacterial mastitis as a possible cause of painful, red breast and 101F fever
Fails to consider other possible causes of the symptoms, such as breast engorgement or abscess
Seeks additional information from the user about their medical history or symptoms
Advises the patient to seek immediate medical attention if their symptoms worsen or they experience difficulty breathing
Incorrectly suggests that the patient should take a certain medication without consulting a healthcare professional
Uses clear and concise language to explain the treatment plan
Fails to provide a clear plan for follow-up care
Correctly explains the importance of completing the full course of antibiotics
Does not consider the patient's ability to understand complex medical information
Provides a clear summary of the patient's condition and treatment plan for the OB/GYN handoff
